channel.title: d o t - a r t

image.title: d o t - a r t

item.title: Go SuperLambananas Print Launched
item.description: We are delighted to anounce the launch of a fantastic new limited edition print by Peter Carr to celebrate the Go Superlambanana project currently in progress around Liverpool and the surrounding area. This unique and striking image is available in a range of sizes, on paper on canvas, with prices starting at just �50. "Go Superlambananas" is produced in a limited edition of 200, and each piece is signed and numbered by the artist.

item.title: dot-art Presents...
item.description: dot-art is delighted to announce the launch of a diverse exhibition of work by five Liverpool based artists. dot-art asked the group to create work in any media in response to a derelict warehouse. The results will provoke, intrigue and delight.

item.title: The Long Night of the Biennial
item.description: dot-art will be taking part in the Long Night of the Biennial event on Thursday 30th October. For one night only, art galleries and studios across the city will be holding a variety of events right through to 11pm. dot-art Gallery will be open until 9.30pm, so please drop in and join us for a drink and a browse!

item.title: Vote for dot-art!
item.description: dot-art has been shortlisted in the Liverpool Style Awards, Business and Enterprise Category! If you would like to vote for us (and we would very much appreciate it!) please click here.

item.title: Order in time for Christmas...
item.description: Please note: the last order dates for guaranteed Christmas delivery are as follows... Originals - 17TH DECEMBER. Prints - 10TH DECEMBER. Happy Shopping!

item.title: Christmas Closing
item.description: dot-art will be closing at 4pm on Tuesday 23rd December. We would like to wish all our customers a very Merry Christmas and a Happy New Year!

item.title: We Are Moving!
item.description:
From mid-January, we will be moving to No. 16 Queen Avenue. You will find us 4 doors down from our current space- just ring the bell!
Watch this space for more details in 2009...

item.title: We Have Moved!
item.description: From Monday 19th January 2009, we will be based at No. 16 Queen Avenue. You will find us 5 doors down from our old gallery - just ring the bell! more...

item.title: Cities Print Collection
item.description: Following the success of the "Cities" exhibition by Stephen Collett and subsequent auction, where nearly �1000 was raised for charity, we are delighted to announce that the collection is now available to buy as limited edition prints, starting at just �85. more...

item.title: New dot-art Website!
item.description: The dot-art website has had a makeover, and now has a shiny new homepage, smoother navigation, better search and filter tools and lots of other great features. Please take a look, and let us know if you have any feedback, good or bad...

item.title: Standing Out in Art
item.description: On Thursday 19th March, dot-art and Striding Out are hosting a networking and speaker event at FACT, Wood Street, Liverpool. The event is open to all visual artists in the Liverpool area who would like more information about the help and support available to them to progress with their artistic ambitions. more...

item.title: dot-art on Twitter
item.description:
You can now keep up to date with the goings on a dot-art via Twitter. Here are some of our most recent tweets to give you a taster... dot-art has opportunities for North West based sculptors- please get in touch. / Just subscribed to interesting "twitter tips" blog: http://www.twitip.com/ / Liverpool 2008 celebrated in photographic exhibition at 08 Place: http://tinyurl.com/dzt96q / Great article on how to market commercial property using art: http://tinyurl.com/d5l276 / Not quite sure what we actually do?! Our new look newsletter should help...http://tinyurl.com/datvat.
more...

item.title: New Show at dot-art: Green Mersey
item.description: 5th May - 5th June 2009. Featuring work by six local artists: four painters and two photographers, Green Mersey is a collection of work celebrating the green spaces on our doorstep in Liverpool's Year of the Environment 2009. more...

item.title: Pop- Up Gallery at Cavern Walks
item.description: 2nd May onwards. From Saturday 2nd May 2009, dot-art is proud to present a Pop-Up Gallery in Liverpool's iconic Cavern Walks. The exhibition features Gary Beach's evocative painterly representations of Liverpool city centre, focusing on the �Beatles Quarter�, the streets around the designer shopping centre. Meanwhile Helene Gilmour's contemporary prints bring out Cavern Walks� funky, feminine character. more...

item.title: New Featured Artist - Tony Evans
item.description: Tony specialises in animals in action using mainly copper and bronze and the work is a result of hours of intense concentration and physical effort. His portrayals of nature capture the spirit and to the splendour of a whole menagerie of animals ranging from the simplicity of a frog to the magnificence of a life size Bengal tiger. more...

item.title: Event - Live! in St Pauls Square
item.description: On Thursday 4th June 2009, this free event saw a selection of dot-art's artists giving live demonstrations while urban artist Simon Mack created a giant piece of work which has been specially commissioned for the square. more...
